body.p:
Jefferson Circuit Court
Commonwealth Ky Plff
vs } Brief for Straus before the Governor
Andrew Straus Deft

I would suggest to your Excellency, that this is a case pending in the Jefferson Circuit Court of The Commonwealth vs Andrew Straus- a Scirefacias on an old bail-bond given in 1855, as Surety for one Charles Wicke. The facts are Stated in Straus' petition, & the letter of W. A. Ronald, Sheriff.

There is no Judgmt yet against Straus. The summons was not Served in time for the Oct term of our court. And I think it is a case where the the remiting power can be Judicially and properly exercised to to prevent a Judgement.
For your power to remit the whole of it I refer you to "Article 3d Section 10 of "The New Consitution Ky." Stanton's Rev. Statutes page 129 of 1st vol.
And also the case of Commonwealth vs Morgan 14. B Monroe 392. And the Commonwealth vs Spraggins. 18. B. Monroe 513.

I would not be understood as desiring
to deprive the officers of the Circuit Court of their legitimate fees, nor the Commonwealth's atty. But this is a case wherein the ^present^ States attorny has had no trouble; nor would he ever have Set this prosecution on foot, if it had not been for this man Fehrrenback. It appears to me that this is a case where excutive interposition is demanded. The Commonwealth Should not be made the instrument through and by which to grati the personal Spite of one individual ^citizen^ toward another=; and especially where no public good can result from it, as in this case. The Judgmt against F. is about all Straus is worth; and if he is made to pay the $800 recognizance it will ruin him
